column14:
I made an appointment through the Genesis app. When I arrived I was told they were short staffed and it would be a four hour wait. Apparently someone was supposed to have called and informed me of this in advance, but this did not happen.

I made an appointment again for drop-off for the following day. Everything went smoothly except an issue with the vehicle could not be determined. It's a lease and I only have less than a year left, so I'm not concerned about it.

My car was very clean when I dropped it off. I had just had it washed a couple of days before. When I picked it up it had been parked in the back of the lot and was covered in dust. There was oil droplets on the front grill area (had an oil change) and handprints all over the vehicle.

Not at all the level of care I expect from a brand that markets as luxury. Also, I never am assisted by a Genesis service representative. I had better care with Acura. Overall disappointed with Holler from the beginning.

Thank you

column14: Based on my experience with scheduling my first service, I would not recommend the brand. That said, it’s my understanding that a stand alone Genesis dealership is opening on Fulton in Sacramento and Roseville Hyundai is building a separate and dedicated Genesis service garage. We will see how that goes. A lack of stand alone Genesis dealerships and better service experience/availability trumps all of the nice things about the vehicle up to this point. God forbid I ever have a serious issue with this vehicle. The Greater Sacramento area is simply too large to not have at least one stand alone Genesis dealership and more than one  service option. There can’t be only one game in town. Online scheduling also allowed me to book service in Folsom. I took time off work to drive out, only to be told they don’t service Genesis at that dealership any longer. No apologies were made. I waited to speak on the phone to the service manager at Roseville for 16 mins before finally hanging up. I then called Genesis direct and they put in a call to have a manager call me and I still never received a call back about the scheduling fiasco (waiting 7 weeks for an oil change). Lastly, once I finally received service, I waived the car wash and vacuum, as it was a rainy day and because I’m very meticulous. However, the construction must have had them drive my vehicle or walk over a dirt/muddy road, as dirt and debris was all over my floor. I had just vacuumed beforehand, so it was very apparent.  I mean, it’s a nice vehicle. If shoes are really dirty or muddy, use a temporary paper floor mat cover. That said, use temporary floor mat covers regardless. I shouldn’t have to come home and wipe dirt off the floor. I even covered my seat and center console with towels to protect the Vanilla Beige interior and the console towel was in the floor when the car was given back to me. The entire experience was unacceptable and very disappointing. Wouldn't experience any of this at Lexus or even Toyota for that matter! The person that helped me on the day of the appointment was the only bright spot.

column14:
My concern was that I was told that to get a loaner car to service my brand new GV80 would take 3 months.  I find it unacceptable that an $80K has such poor service.
When the Genesis representative responded to my feedback, he said that Genesis has no way to help since the loaners are provided by the dealership.   I can tell you that having had many car brands in the past, I have never experienced such problems with a loaner.  At this price point I question Genesis long term relationship with customers if the service experience is going to be as bad as what I am experiencing.
To add to this, my service advisor from the dealership never returned my call.  The dealership is Napeleton Genesis, west palm beach and my service advisor is Alexander Altunashvili.

column14: I bought a genesis in Evansville,In in August off 2022. When I purchased my car, I was promised concierge service for the first 3 years. Instead, I had to locate my own tire and I’m still waiting (3 weeks) for a windshield. I have to drive to Louisville Kentucky (180 miles) to get my oil changed for free as promised when I purchased the vehicle. So I’m greatly disappointed in all the things I was promised when I purchased the vehicle vs the service I have received since my purchase. I’m considering selling the vehicle because of the service that I was promised aid an simply not receiving because there is not not a dealership locally. I think that’s a bad deal. I was mislead on what I was promised.

column14:
Time after time, Genesis does not fail to disappoint as a brand.  Any time I have reached out to ask a question or report a problem, I have been dismissed by a representative who has no concern at all for me as a customer. While I appreciate the "we already have your money" mentality, I didn't expect that would be my experience from a self-proclaimed "luxury" brand. When other car manufacturers attempt to politely resolve issues and address concerns, Genesis has eagerly ignored me at every opportunity.

I could not be less satisfied with my ownership experience. From the terrible connected services (which don't en work anymore) to the disdainful treatment by service departments to the complete lack of care from Genesis as a brand, you have been consistent in your failure to provide customer service.

The next time I have a problem, I'll consider telling a housecat. It will have similar results but save a lot of time. I have been telling everyone who will listen what a disappointment this car is, and I look forward to continuing to spread the word.  I have no doubt at all that you don't care, as that seems to be the hallmark of the brand.

Will think twice before buying another Genesis....

My recent experience with support was related to a PIN issue I was having with the phone app for my Genesis. The phone technician was extremely patient and helpful as we worked through the issue. She was excellent. 

My low ranking for recommending the brand is related to the continued poor service I have received at NUMEROUS service departments throughout Metro Detroit. I love my G70, but I loathe anytime I need to have any service performed. Genesis has to get this fixed if they want to be a serious contender not just in the luxury market, but as a simple car brand.  Contact me anytime for additional details. 

Mike Kozak
mdkozak@gmail.com

column14: I have been faithful in keeping up my maintenance as required. I have had my car 45 months and about 29000 miles. No one has ever told me that the filters were ever changed. I checked all of the invoices that I have since I’ll purchase the vehicle and going over these and papers it does not say one time that the filters are checked or changed the filters were filthy I can’t imagine with 25,000 miles the filters were check with each maintenance. I believe that after the warranty wore out they check the filters probably for the first time.  I have talked to a car mechanic. The filters were checked with all my maintenance skews me my courtesy maintenance. I went to get my normal maintenance. It was time and I also wanna windshield wipers and I thought they would change the oil and rotate the tires like they always do because that’s what the purple paperwork says but this time it happens to be that the filters need to be changed and I was not expecting a 243 bill dollar bill for replacing these filters when they should have been checked and changed as needed. Thank you so much for listening.

column14:
This is a difficult survey to respond to.  First of all, if I'd known that I would not be able to locate a Genesis dealership to have my service needs tended to, I WOULD NOT have purchased my beautiful GV80!  I have driven only high end luxury vehicles for the last 25 years, and have become accustomed to going to their high end facilities for service.  There is a HUGE gap in what I'm used to and what a Hyundai dealership offers!  
Regarding my experience with the Genesis concierge service, it was a mix of quality.  Susan was friendly and seemed competent.  However, the details she gave me regarding what I would receive at the Hyundai service appointment did not line up with what reality was.  For example, she told me that my first service should be done at 1 year or 7,000 or 8,000 (I can't remember which of these 2 numbers she stated) miles, whichever came first (I have owned my vehicle since 10-30-2021, and I was at a 6600+ miles.),  and that I needed to get the service done asap, since I'd passed the 1 year mark.  The service adviser at the Hyundai dealership told me that my first service was not due until 8,000 miles, and that having it done now will throw off my service timeline.  Since I had had a frustrating time even getting an appointment for service, he kindly agreed to go ahead and do the service.  Susan also told me that after the completion of service, my car would be thoroughly cleaned.  The service advisor told me that is not the case, that all they do is run it through a wash for exterior wetting, but no drying and no interior cleaning at all.  I don't know why there was such a disconnect between what Susan in concierge services and what the service advisor at the dealership said, but it was very discouraging for me.  Overall,  my opinion of Genesis has dropped dramatically because of all this.  On a side note, I actually contacted concierge because of the trouble I had getting into a Hyundai dealership for service.  I lived in the Dallas-Forth Worth metroplex, and the only dealership that even answered my calls was in Denton, which is 51.7 miles from my home.  The dealerships literally either did not answer the phone at all, or the service department did not answer my transferred calls.  One transfer call to the service department (Weatherford, TX), had a message instructing me to leave a message; however, the voicemail was full and could not accept any more calls!  Genesis surely understands that people who purchase luxury vehicles expect a higher standard of service!

column14:
There was a curious issue that arose during my visit. Talking with the service counter receptionist about my cruise control issue which i had come in for , he offered a simple fix associated with my regenerative braking system. He was suggesting to lower it fro L3 to L1 or zero and it might work better. He than was “shushed” by a lead technician who then starting to detail how this problem coukd only be determined by removing the front bumper which would cost an intial
$507. This shocked me and i refused this type of service and asked them to rotate tires and do a visual of front bumper sensors to the best of their abilities. Of course I got my car back they found nothing so I went out on the highway , put cruise control on with level L1 and of course it worked fine. It all felt a little creepy and I will be very wary in all of my future service calls , which is very unfortunate give the high price I paid for this car .

column14:
My 2020 g80 is my second Genesis.  The cars are great.  I gave my 2015 Genesis to one of our sons and he loves it.  As you well know, you have found it MUCH easier to build a great car than to have a Great dealer network.  I am waiting for a call from West Houston Hyundai/Genesis to tell me that they have received a replacement radio to replace the one that I reported defective in December while still under warranty.  The dealer gave me a computer chip for me to put into the dash slot but that did not fix the problem.  The dealer's main telephone is often not answered at all or a message machine asks you to leave a message and the person never returns your call - NOT GOOD.  I made about six attempts in January involving at least six
phone attempts to no avail, thus prompting my call to Genesis National Customer Care.  All I want is my defective radio replaced.  Good luck in improving your dealer network - I know that it is not easy.  Your great cars deserve it!!

column14:
The Service group is second-tp-none.  Always helpful and they treat the customer in a special way as to build confidence and loyalty in the dealership.  One walks away feeling valued...  I really like the new online status view of one's service  session.  I typically wait for my vehicle and this new tool keeps me informed of what is going on in the service area with my vehicle.  And from time to time, there is a little 'perk' thrown in (you ask them to do something fully expecting to be charged for it and it gets done at no-charge)!  Amazing in my view.  

And if you really like the vehicle that they sold you (Genesis G80),  you leave with the feeling of  'why would I ever go any place else for my next car.'  Their business model is complete/5-star from Sales to Service.

column14: I am driving my 4th Genesis and love the car.  My husband and I always lease and our last two leases were through South Shore Hyundai in West Islip, NY.  The lease on our 2019 G80 would have been up March of 2022. In March of 2021 the dealer reached out and asked us to come in, we thought to turn our leased vehicle in early.  They encouraged us to switch to ownership since Covid was effecting supply and price.  We were very reticent to do this but were pressured and told turning it in would not be a problem and our lease price would remain about the same whenever we did it.  Recently we received  a recall notice and our Connected Services were eliminated so we decided to turn the car in.  We were shocked when this same dealer told us our lease would be an extra $500 a month and we should never have on off lease!  We were used and abused.  They suggested we get rid of warranties we have to lower the buyout price.  Repeated calls and emails to the salesman about how we accomplish have gone unanswered.  In good faith we actually ordered a new Genesis but we don't have any good faith left.

column14:
I own a 2021 Genesis GV80 with approximately 6000 miles.   I find it hard to believe that a vehicle that is 1 1/2 years old needs a GPS update and until I updated it, could not use it.   The update process was terrible, to say the least.   The Genesis rep basically gave me a quick rundown of what I was going to have to do, but after trying to do this to no avail, I called back and they connected me to the navigation updater site.   This again, was quite confusing as I had to purchase a thumb drive.   Then, after repeated attempts, the navigator update rep walked me through the process.  He was not the most cordial person and this took considerable time.   I was very displeased with the whole process.
Genesis needs to fix this and be more consumer friendly in the process.   I would like to recommend Genesis vehicles, but would have to rethink this based on my experience.

column14: Brought my GV80 in for it's first service appointment.  Dealership wouldn't provide concierge service.  Was told everything had been done including rotating tires and wheels.  Was marked as such on the paperwork I was given.  We knew the tires had not been rotated because of a mark on one of the wheels.  When questioned about it the first time I was assured they had been rotated.  When I advised him that I could tell the tires had not been rotated he said oh yeah...we couldn't rotate them because they were overinflated.  I asked him how that could happen when we had not put any air in them.  He had no explanation.  This left me wondering what else hadn't been done that they said they had done.  Not the service experience I expected.

column14: My representative did an excellent job in communicating with me on what they were doing to resolve my issue. Unfortunately, the direction from Genesis Engineering Corporate was not accurate, and they- (my dealer representative) , wasted an entire day chasing down a resolution that did NOT exist. My dealer's representative- Paul Walkins was able to figure out a solution and resolve my issues on the third day.  So my score of 5 whether I would recommend Genesis is that Genesis Corporate has fallen short on their concierges service-loaner vehicle, and that they did not give my dealer the correct diagnosis causing additional delays. In fact, I will be contacting my dealer again, as some other issues developed from the update nav which is where all the problems started. Genesis has a very barbaric method of updating the nav system, and although it's updated, it has changed some things in the system overall. The volume is now very much lower, and when you shut the car off the aux. does not stay on for the 5 minutes it used to. I hope to see Genesis stick to their model of luxury vehicles, with loaner vehicles, and service that exceeds the industry standards. I hope they can change my mind on their brand. This is NOT a reflection of my service advisor, he worked very hard to fix my car.

column14: I needed to update my GPS. It took SEVEN (7) calls to Customer Care to get all the information required to update it so that I could receive OTA updates. And because I have to wait for a USB from Mapnsoft, I still don’t know what will happen when I actually download the first update. Each time I called, I got another small piece of information. I finally learned on the 3rd or 4th call that the first update has to be loaded manually - which is nonsense! Then I purchased a larger USB for $52 that I didn’t need to download the update but it didn’t work because it was too large!! (It is ridiculous by the way that if you buy a larger USB than needed, it won’t work - of course no one told me that until after I bought the $52 USB and tried to load the update!!) I finally learned what the Mapnsoft was needed for and ordered the USB from them! So I spent probably 4 hours going back and forth trying to figure it out, download the update and trying to install it. It was my most frustrating experience with Genesis to date. I hope I don’t experience it again. The way to update GPS should be clearly explained and perhaps emails sent out to customers or maybe even just send the USB from Mapnsoft if it can’t be done automatically the first time as would be expected for a luxury brand.
column71: MAP UPDATE INQUIRY OTA MAP UPDATE INQUIRY

column14: Representative was excellent in communication skills BUT not properly trained by Genesis.  My Genesis Connected Care expired in January (3 years after purchase).  Like many things, I was told I would have it for 10 years or 100,000 miles after purchase some expensive add on by your finance guy - total cost about $4000.  So I called to get info and was told there were 3 levels of "connection," each costing $99 per year.  But if I could get a 20% discount.  After repeatedly asking for a better "deal" I was told if I ordered 2 levels I could get a 40% discount, which I did.  Only then while reviewing off unopened emails did I see an off to purchase at 50% off.  This is one reason car dealers have such a shady reputation.  I love my car but hate the buying experience for a car costing $85000.  I expected Genesis to be an up and coming brand like Lexus (that I owned since 1990).  Instead Hyundai is only a "want a be Toyota."  I even removed the G E N E S I S letters on the rear (trunk) since my experiences have been so negative.

column14: Our service advisor Melisa was helpful and extremely knowledgeable, I appreciate all of her efforts.  It was a pleasant surprise to see that the service tech cleaned/rinsed off the 'WeatherTech' style floor mats.  However the mats were put in the vehicle while still wet on the bottom side, causing the carpet to become wet.  Although it was apparent the mats were cleaned, the fact that the carpet was wet was uncovered a couple days later given the interior of the windows would keep uncharacteristically fog up after the car sat for a period of time after driving.  At time of discovery the carpet was still damp and the mats had to be removed in order to circulate the floor heater to finish drying the carpet.   Although a minor annoyance if left unnoticed the carpet could have become moldy/smelly.  Only pointing this out to avoid from happening again.  Otherwise extremely happy with the service received.

column14: You, the Genesis brand, are trying to grow to compete against established players! However, you are NOT performing well in your customer service experience. You have promised too much, and are consistently under-delivering.  Your Hyandai representatives were courteous and professional in their approach at the Glendale shop, but my experience was akin to taking a Benz to a Chevy dealer. I deliberately paid an extra 10K plus to not have a Telluride of Pallisade experience when buying the Genesis, but believ me I regret my decision now. Your entire brand is showing prolonged teething problems. Your Genesis Concierge is a JOKE! Your vehicle software is designed for grandmothers with an array of annoying restrictive “safety” features that CANNOT be turned off. And why in the world is it not possible to truly personalize profiles, and have it be saved for good (Auto-hold, for instance).  The list is too long if you care to listen, BUT to top it all off, I have NEVER taken a car for a scheduled service (from cheap subcompacts to truly luxury brands) where the dealer has returns the car to me WITHOUT a car wash!  This last part of the service experience is truly bewildering, again cheapening the brand experience that you so desperately want to improve.

column14: I have been trying to get my navigation updated.  My Dealer (Homestead Hyundai Genesis) was unwilling to do the update while I had it in for service recently. They said It was an easy OTA update.  Prior to making the service appointment I had been trying for months to do the update via Flash drive. It will either not load onto my flash drive or when I get it to the car, the "update" button is not highlighted, so the download can not begin. The customer service person I spoke with on Saturday was very helpful but unable to resolve my issue.  It should not be this difficult to update my navigation. I am not sure why my dealer would  not do it while they had my car for service. They also do not offer concierge service and I live about 40 miles from the closest dealer. I have to take a day off of work every time I to have my car serviced. Probably wouldn't have gone with Genesis if I knew this wasn't an actual option for me.

column14: I am experiencing problems with the App/connected services that I had not my my Volvo, the previous car i drove. It's good to HAVE concierge, YES, but I'd prefer to have nothing to call about! With concierge on the phone...it's a long and complicated process. They are not trained properly - to  go about explaining the problem the right way. They should say: this is the problem:...and - this is what you need to do:... They do not tell you what the problem is, you're in the dark, and then they say: do this, go there, do this...NO, that is not the way. Tell me: your car computer needs to reboot. You need to press Map and Setup simultaneously for 10 seconds to reboot. THAT'S the way to quickly help/explain things. Could not be simpler.

column14:
This call has restored my faith in Genesis. I sold a Porsche Cayenne to buy this vehicle. There are quirks in the Genesis, like the cell phone charger doesn't charge our iPhones. The main screen was locked in night mode, but the full reset fixed that problem. (The representative on this call said he has never seen this problem).  It seems that when (2) people are in the car and both have their remotes, my saved positions do not really reset to my set positions.  As a whole the local dealers are always too busy to answer questions or actually fix a problem (wireless charger).  My wife loves the vehicle, but I'm used to Porsche service. 
I'm hopeful that when there are dedicated Genesis buildings the experience will get better.

column14: The representative was courteous and helpful. He handled my concerns appropriately.  He said I needed to take the car in for for service,  which was neither surprising nor upsetting.  And, the fact that the dealership responded with an appointment four weeks away was not his fault. In fact, he apologized for it. But, the idea that it takes a month to get a service appointment (and this is not the first time I experienced this) leads directly to my dissatisfaction with both the customer care experience and my disinclination to recommend Genesis as a brand. (This is NOT a luxury car ownership experience.) This despite my overall appreciation of my G90.  It's a great car, and I really enjoy driving it. However, I am dreading this service appointment. My nav screen is delaminating and the entire nav unit is randomly freezing and has lost touch with my phone app. I also cannot use the Google navigation aid despite having a subscription. It always tells me I have no network connection. And, the rep tells me that as a second owner I have no warranty coverage. So, my choices will, I suspect, be a prohibitive repair bill or a severely crippled "luxury" car.

column14: First, Scott called me regarding my emailed issue on the very day I sent it in and that day was listed that Customer Care was closed. I was surprised to get that quick a response, especially on a "closed" day. I much appreciate the manner he handled my situation and the ease and timeliness of the correction to the issue. Kudos to Scott!! That being said, the following has nothing to do with my interaction with Scott. However, I am taking the opportunity to express my disappointment with the Genesis brand since our purchase due the manner in which Genesis and their relationship with dealers has evolved. Because of Genesis desire to evolve their brand, the Genesis dealership I purchased my car from, ceased to perform any covered service on the car. The explanation was that Genesis wanted the brand to disassociate from the Hyundai dealership unless they provided a standalone location. The dealership did not provide one, so they had to cease sale of Genesis vehicles and no longer provide the maintenance service included with the Genesis vehicles without the customer paying for the service. This dealership was 70 miles from my home (which I accepted as I wanted the Genesis brand), however I now must schedule and drive over 200 miles to obtain the service and maintenance which was part of the specifications in the car purchase. Not only is this inconvenient and requires overnight stays or possibly additional transportation costs, but in general, is totally unacceptable. As a customer, I have been placed in middle of this "tug-of-war" and feel that the corporation cares little about me as a consumer of their product. This should not happen with a vehicle purchased at this price point (or any other for that matter). As a result this has dampened my enthusiasm for the vehicle brand.

column14: I made the call because of the lack of Genesis car service availability. On March 13, I reached out to Wayne Genesis, NJ, where I purchased the car, and requested to schedule an oil and change of filters.  The first available date they offered was September 11.  (six months) What if I needed serious work on the car. Could my engine seize if I wait six months?  I then reached out to Genesis of Denville, NJ to request the same service and I was told they were no longer taking new customers.  Your agent was able to get into the Denville Dealer's computer and booked an oil change for April 5 for me.  I asked the agent what is going on with the lack of available service, to which he replied, " I got you an appointment, didn't I?"  I am sorry I purchased the Genesis and currently looking at alternatives.  A car is only as good as the support behind it.  Genesis sucks at it and I will do everything in my power to let my opinion be known.

column14:
I felt Genesis Customer Care passed the buck, so to speak. the reason I reached out was because a part to repair my vehicle (a 2022 GV70) cannot be located by the body shop who has been working a number of supplier lines, including through the local Hyundai dealer. I thought I made that clear and was hoping Genesis corporate could help locate the part. (Although, since then we have heard the part may not be manufactured again which seems wildly unimaginable for a 2022 model.)
I love my GV70. It is one of the quietest, most comfortable and fun-to-drive cars I've ever owned. But the inability to get a basic (yet critical) part and well as the scarcity of trained Genesis technicians makes me reluctant to keep my vehicle once it is repaired (if that ever happens) and reluctant to recommend the brand to family, friends and colleagues.

I was told to call the Genesis Customer Care center, which I did and it was closed. On Monday I called back to speak with the manager who told me that nothing was done that would cause my phone to be disconnected and if I needed to have it reconnect I should bring the car in. I think my car and all the connections should be working as they did prior to the service - very disappointing.

column14:
I'm a Genesis owner and I love my Genesis BUT I'm a little upset with Genesis and HYUNDAI.  I have a 2011 Genesis and that makes it 11 years old.  Both the companies have parts that are unavailable to purchase.  I thought there was a law the forbiding Car Manufacturing companies not having parts available especially an 11 year old car.  I needed a CPU and I can't purchase one from any dealership in So. California.  I purchased a used one on EBAY.  Now the dealerships won't download the VIN Number for my car onto the used CPU.  Thus this forces me to have to get rid of my car.  That makes me very reluctant to purchase another GENESIS nor ANY HYUNDAI car.  I'm very upset with the way HYUNDAI and Genesis are run regarding discontinuance of parts on fairly new cars.

Regards,

Don Fackler

column14: My rating is no reflection on the Customer Care rep who assisted me, they were very kind and tried to help.   My rating is due to my experience with trying to get my vehicle serviced.   There is only 1 Genesis dealership in my area, and it is impossible to get ahold of their service department to get the vehicle serviced.   Genesis CC is also not able to get resolution for me with them.  Therefore I am spending a large amount of money on a vehicle that is in need of service, and I am unable to talk to anyone or go online and schedule it.   I have never experienced this before with any other vehicle either myself or my husband has owned.  I love my car, but not if I have to drive around with a check engine light, a faulty low tire warning without any resolution for getting it serviced, I do not want it.  I expect much better for the type of vehicle that I own and the money I have paid for it.    It took me 4 months last year to get my last check engine light worked on, til finally the Genesis died, and had to be towed in.  It is beyond comprehension that Genesis would allow such poor service to be associated with their product.

column14: Thank you for this opportunity to respond.  I was given a claim # 21119037 and never heard back again.  I have had a G80 for 5 years and it has been a great car and never had to do anything other than standard maintenance until now.  The entire wheel cardboard assembly became detached as the car appears to be low to the ground and the bumper has been manually attached back several times in the past.  I decided that since my dealer is now only a Hyundai dealer and only services my 2018 model I thought that it would be a good idea to go to a Genesis dealer for this service and would also allow me to see the new cars as I may be in the market later this year.  I called Irvine Genesis and talked with a Norma Ochoa (?) and she gave me an appointment for the following week but we needed to order the part and prepay for it.  I sent her a photo of what had become detached so she could order only what I need but never could complete the order.  I called 16 (sixteen) times to try to straighten it out but could never get a good response and that is when I contacted Genesis and still never got a response.  The one time I did reach her she did not have a record of the appointment booked.  I have since gone back to Hyundai in Tustin where they looked at what I need and ordered the part which hopefully will get there for my Thursday appointment.   To have only one inept dealer in an affluent area like Orange County Ca. is not a good business model if you want to expand your sales.  Until this incident my probable recommendation regarding the brand would have been a 10 but poor servicing could be a problem.  Thank you.

column14:
I responded earlier on your web page.  I was delighted by the assistance your representative was able to provide.  I misplaced her name but she is very much an asset to your company.   I hope you all listen to the phone conversation I had with her. 
I was so dismayed by your local dealership here in Daytona Beach.  Their voice mail system in the service area is totally non-existent.  According to them no one can retrieve any voice messages left on their system do therefore they never return any calls.  I literally had to drive 15 +/- miles to the dealership to book my appointment.   They also supposedly have only one person who can book service for my Genesis GV80.  That's ridiculous.   I totally understand you only want certified/trained Genesis mechanics working on the vehicles,  however if the service department has even a simple computer system any advisor should be able to book an appointment.   I will be glad to discuss other issues if you are interested.  You have my contact information.

I don't know where to turn next.      Ewing Werlein, Jr.

column14: I’am a first time Genesis owner. I have had a GV80 for a year and a half. I absolutely love the car and its features.I’am 72 years old an owned BMW, Lincoln(twice) Cadillac and Lexus. The Genesis is a much better car, hands down. Having said that, the Genesis service experience comes no where close to the vehicles I have previously owned. Basically you’re dealing with the experience of buying  and servicing a Hyundai Sonata .I had to buy my GV80 sight un seen, as there were no in stock at Vancouver Genesis.No test drives or anything on that nature. I live in the state of Oregon and there are no Genesis Dealers. The reason you don’t see a lot of Genesis on the road is a lot of people know nothing about them. You need Free Standing Dealerships, who treat customer and the service experience like BMW, Lexus, Cadillac and Lincoln do. I REALIZE THAT IS EASIER SAID THAN DONE!!!

column14:
The CC rep was very professional and responsive to my problem. She did respond with answers that I was able to comprehend and appreciate, including sending me the case # and process for rental reimbursement. My call to Customer Care was for the procedure for reimbursement of a rental as the repairs are clearly warranty issues. Unlike the local service center, who after a roadside vehicle failure on Friday and I was able to bring the vehicle directly to the service center, I have still not heard the status of my vehicle or a loaner. Now Monday 2:20 pm and still no resolution. I stopped into service center at 1 pm again offered "waiting on my manager" re the loaner, and no answer yet as to status of my needed repairs. 
This is the 2nd time for my service at this location, and both times a loaner was unavailable.  If I understood the Genesis commitment correctly, when service is performed, the vehicle is to be picked up and returned to my location? This is all very concerning. Both my partners (brothers) have Mercedes and they get without any hassle pickup and delivery at each service need. And, that dealer travels a few miles to our office, which is less than 1/2 mile from "my Genesis" service center.

A RECALL THAT REOCCURS SHOULD BE TREATED AS A RECALL AGAIN,  especially since it is the exact same safety issue.    I need help,   Please contact me as my car remains at dealer waiting to hear if administration stands behind  rectifying the original recall especially since it is the exact same pipe and leak causing the problem

Got a new tire on Monday before we headed back home. BUT because we didn't get "permission" they are refusing to reimburse us for the cost of the tire. Like I was thinking about permission or anything else when I actually thought we might die!!! column14:
Which customer care Center experience??
It’s been months since my last contact with the national level. THIS IS NOT ABOUT HUNDAI. THIS IS ABOUT OUR LOCAL DEALERSHIP.  
My local dealer and service center is Gettel Hundai of Sarasota, Fl. They are hard to contact, and seem to want me to leave a message ant every different phone number,  and WAIT for them to call you back-which never occurred. Only after my 4-days of attempting to contact, and my persistence, did the phone receptionist hand carry a note to the service department did they call me back. I purchased the new GV80 last Oct. This is my very first attempt at getting service at my purchasing dealership-and it has been a failure.   
You should look into this dealership who is representing your company. 
Sorry to vent here. But I don’t know who to complain to?
John

column14:
Please do not the 1 rating to your representative. Although I do not remember her name, she was kind, courteous, and respectful. She is a credit to your staff. Your 1 rating was earned because your company did not have a solution for my problem.

I own a 2017 G80. The reason I called Customer Care was to find a solution for the loss of connectivity between my car and your company's app. I enjoyed the ability to remotely start my car with climate control (as I live in Southern Arizona). As of 2023, that feature is no longer available. Worse, your company provides no solution/work around.

Providing a solution to this common problem would raise your company to the 5 rating that your Customer Care representative earned.

column14:
Cars are great. But your dealership and customer service is a disaster! I’m here in WA state, and all the time had issues with Everett dealership. Once they didn’t finish the oil changing service completely and my car started leaking oil in the middle of road and couldn’t drive more. 
Second time because they didn’t have enough technician, and it was one hour before closing, they refused to provide the full oil changing services and they just changed the oil and didn’t check the routine services. However in the final receipt they said they checked which the didn’t. Since the entire process only took 15 minutes! 
Lastly I have engine light check on! I called customer service and scheduled a repair service with this dealership. Later that day dealership called me and said don’t come that day. They only gave me another option for 8 days later and one specific time, otherwise they said we will give you time after 4-5 weeks, without providing a rental car. When I asked if I can drive the car with this engine light on and code P303, they said we don’t know. Just drive it and if fails, call the towing company so they can tow the car to here, but again no rental car. 
I’m not sure how you’re calling this a luxury brand? Being luxurious means everything should be at the best service and quality. Not just that make something fancy, without providing a normal services. Even cheap brands have better services than Genesis in USA. When you go to Toyota, Nissan, Subaru, Lexus, or other brands, they all provide the best services with having rental cars available. Even for oil changing services. But these Gensis dealerships in WA state, are the worse I’ve ever seen. Below the basic level. 

I still have my engine light on, and dealership refused to provide me services till next week. And if I don’t make it in that specific time they said, I have to wait for another 5 weeks! I’m regretting buying this car, because serives and dealerships are below the normal level. Rude people with the most poor services.

column14: Service representative quoted me an incorrect price on a new tire to replace my tire that was reported as having a puncture.  The difference was $85 in the price of the tire. She did not inform me until she called to tell me my car was being delivered and if she should use the card on file.  I asked what the total was, and it was close to $500.  That was when she informed me the tire was not $316 it was $399. I could not afford the new tire at $399 and asked if they could waive the $45 installation fee. I was then told the installation fee could not be waived because they had to pay the technician to install it. I told her I could not pay for the tire; I just lost my job and was on a budget. She informed me that they could put my old tire back on and deliver my car back to me, which they did.  So, it's interesting that the installation fee could not be waived but it turned out that the technician installed and uninstalled the tire without the $45.  I love my Genesis, the sales team is amazing and the last time I had my car serviced, it was great. This experience was much different and shocking that no one was willing to work with me. The mistake was made from a Genesis employee, yet I, the customer, was going to have to pay for her mistake. A better outcome would have been to honor the price I was quoted to retain a happy customer.

column14: I have owned many luxury brands over the years. The level and lack of customer service does not match the car. Extremely disappointed. Dealer returned my car with update unsuccessful error. I do not have the time to sit in my car, take screen shots to diagnose my car's issues for the "Genesis Engineers. "  I expect the Service Dept. to perform these tasks. YOUR Genesis rep called the dealer closest to my home and I was in on the 3 way call.  Dealer told the Genesis Rep I should take the car back to the dealer I bought it from. TOTALLY unacceptable.  You are going to have to do a real sell job for me to purchase another when my lease is up in 2024. I have filled out numerous surveys and have yet to have any type of follow up.  Cadillac has the best service in the business from delivery to the service department. I hate the aggravation with this car. My rearview mirror is dangling, my steering wheel doesn't retract or tilt, side mirrors aren't folding in, cold air continually blows thru vents when heat is on, not to mention my app is not functioning. I contacted the dealer closest to my home and the service manager told me that he thinks I wasn't given proper delivery of my vehicle. He suggested it could be operator error. Again, he asked me where I purchased this car from. Who cares and why does it matter? It has a warranty for the duration of my lease.  Please don't call me and leave a voice mail to instruct me to take screenshots of my car running to try and diagnose its issue. If this is such a level of concern, please call me personally. 1.630.363.1790. My husband is a die hard, loyal, Hyundai owner. However, I am still employed, running my own business and have a financial influence regarding the large purchases in our family.

column14:
Good morning,

Unfortunately, my experience with dealing with the service department was unfavorable. My engine light came on, which is very alarming to say the least. I contacted the Service Department in Southfield, Mi. to schedule an appointment to bring my  2022 GV80 in to get placed on the diagnostic machine  and was told 1.) I would not be able to bring it in until April 24th, which is 2 weeks out and 2.) a loaner car would not be available for me until June. I asked would Genesis accommodate me by paying for a rental vehicle and I was told, no. I have been driving luxury vehicles for over 20 years and I have never experienced this type of service with any of my luxury vehicles. Although, I love my GV80, I am very disappointed with the service department. This issue will definitely make me reconsider purchasing or leasing another vehicle with Genesis.

Thank you,

Kelley Williams

column14: Looking for a resolution to the switch from 3g to 4g for connected services. My 2019 G80 Ultimate is one of the vehicles that lost all connected services when Verizon dropped 3g service on December 31st, 2022. I've heard other manufacturers have either offered a 3g to 4g converter or switched out older units to newer units that supported 4g and newer. At this point Genesis doesn't seem to have a resolution, so I'm without connected services. This is my 6th Hyundai/Genesis and have always promoted the brand. My 2nd Genesis, and have loved both but this definitely is a dark cloud. Doesn't seem like Genesis cares and not even trying to resolve the issue. Disappointing to say the least. Almost a "you bought it, it's not our problem anymore....."  I don't know if this is an issue that they are even looking into but if you have any additional information, that would be great.

column14:
My question had to do with Genesis commitment to the brand. No many stand alone dealerships and service not up to advertising in many cities.
Other luxury dealers like Lexus, Mercedes, Infiniti, Acura, etc have made the commitment. Even Consumer reports review seems to be hedging on reliability and commitment. I wanted to know why? see email exchange below.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I guest the dealer where I live is the problem then. I am to assume that they aren’t ready to commit in my area. I guess I will have to wait to buy a genesis when they do. 
Other car dealers have committed. I guess I need to buy cars from them. Thanks for clearing that up for me.

Dave

column14:
The customer service call was excellent, the issue resolution was a failure.

I love my 2019 G90 and the Google GPS is now functional!  

The issue I encountered was regarding the Genesis to Google GPS handshaking.  The GPS stopped working in June, 2022.  No one at Dennis Hyundai seemed to know the issue was software related.  In fact, I was told to "use the turn signal GPS, it's the same thing as the rear view mirror GPS".  No, it is not.
Dennis replaced the microphone in the car to see if that would fix the Google GPS problem.  Obviously, there was a widespread communication problem-- either Genesis Corporate did not communicate with Dennis or Dennis did not filter the information properly to its Genesis customers.
I have owned BMWs for 15 years and never experienced this type of "dropped ball".

It is unfortunate because, as I said, I love the car.

column14: I called because all of my connected services, satellite connection, and USB connection went out 3 weeks after purchasing my brand new Genesis GV70.  I bought the extended warranty yet was told there was nothing that could be done to fix my car until a software update was released in May that may or may not fix the problem.  I am incredibly disappointed that I purchased a luxury car with the upgraded model and warranty, yet the safety and convenience features that I purchased are broken and unable to be repaired for over a month.  I was told since it doesn't affect safety or driveability that there was nothing that could be done to fix my car until seeing if the software update helps.  Unclear date of update, and unclear if the update would work.  In addition, I would disagree that it is not a safety concern.  On easter I packed up my car with all my belongings and my 3 dogs to head home and one of them stepped on the lock button while my purse was in the car as I was walking around to get in the drivers seat.   The whole car locked down and because there was no connection to the upgraded Genesis Connect features, I was unable to unlock my door with the app and the Genesis representative was unable to unlock the car.  Meanwhile my three dogs are locked inside.  I had to wait an hour for AAA to come help then my car was scratched by the wire used to unlock the doors.  I was grateful he arrived and a scratch is worth it to ensure my dogs aren't locked in the car, but absolutely crazy to me that this happened to a three week old luxury vehicle with 600 miles on it and supposedly under warranty.  I cannot use the navigation in the car or with my phone on apple carplay as neither work, I also can't use the XM satellite radio service I'm paying for.  I'm so incredibly disappointed with the quality and service of Genesis I could cry.  I was very happy with my new car for appx. 3 weeks but am in a loaner now for safety purposes.   The customer service representative was polite when he informed me there was nothing to be done to fix my broken car.

I totalled my vehicle in a snow storm this March so I need something but am still comparing makes.  It will be the last vehicle I buy. Quite a conundrum huh?

column14:
I bought a new G70 car last November. In less than six months, I got a message that there was a problem with the front right light, so I booked the service near my house (GLENVIEW, IL).
When I asked for LOANER SERVICE because it would take 3-4 days, I asked where I bought the car, asked the manager, and he said no.
When I signed the contract, I heard that all services apply equally at all branches, so I checked and signed the contract.
When I complained about it, I came back after a week with LOANER SERVICE, but the next day I called and said that the service was not available, so I hung up. The reason is that the ownership is different.
Does this make sense? I don't know what kind of ownership you're talking about when a large company called Hyundai does this.
I would never have signed a contract if it was only where the service or warranty was purchased.
As a Korean, I was very proud of Hyundai, a Korean company, and I am very disappointed.
Eventually, I contacted the dealer who bought it, and he said he would contact me after checking the schedule.

What I want to know is whether the service you showed me at this branch is the right rule for your company. I'll understand if I misunderstood.

column14: I brought my car in for an issue with the display not working properly.  The next day I texted the service rep requesting the status of my vehicle. She texted me back that it was her day off but she would check.  I didnt hear back so I called to try to talk to service. Four times my call returned to the receptionist. After the fourth attempt to get a service rep to pick up the phone the receptionist took my name and number and said someone would return my call. No one did. The next day I texted the original service rep again and she said she would have an answer by end of day.  End of day she says they cant fix the problem and have to order a part. I'm leaving on a family vacation in two days and my display does not work. No navigation display, no radio display. This is not my first time dealing with extremely poor service at this dealership. I can assure you I will go the extra distance to Stuart in the future. Horrible dealership service.

column14: I typed a long explanation and when I tried to "Submit", your system locked up.  Your survey system works as well as your Navigation system which does not work.  I don't have the energy to type a detailed explanation, AGAIN, especially not knowing if your survey system will lock up this time as well.  But, suffice it to say that I am absolutely fed up with your Navigation System which is NOT RELIABLE and which takes a dealership to update.  This is the second time in the last year that I have (1) initiated the steps to complete the over the air update; (2) reached out to your Customer Care line for help, to no avail; and (3) had to schedule an appointment with the dealership in order to have the Navigation System update completed.  I will no longer be recommending this vehicle to people who ask how I like my Genesis; instead, I will advise people that if they don't care about Navigation or convenient Concierge Service, this is the car and manufacturer for them.  My Navigation system stopped working on Wednesday of last week when I was in an unfamiliar location.  I used Google Maps on my iPhone, instead.  I spent 2 hours of my own time on Thursday downloading the Navigation update onto a USB drive but was unsuccessful in getting the update to install.  I called and spoke with Destiny at the Customer Care connection.  After she was unable to troubleshoot the problem, she placed me on hold for 30+ minutes while she tried to connect to Technical Assistance.  When no one answered, she assured me she would call back once she could connect the 3 of us on a call.  She followed up on her promise and called me back on Tuesday - a full 5 days after I had initially reached out with the problem.  By that time, I had scheduled a service appointment with the dealership to have the Navigation System Update completed at the dealership.  Destiny told me that Technical Assistance advised her that there was an error in the update system.  This is pathetic and not what I expect of a high-end/luxury car.

column14: Monica was attentive, professional, and listened intently to my comments.  I have had a wonderful experience with the Genesis Brand and my Genesis vehicles (my 2017 G90 and my GV80 to date, but I will never visit Genesis of Greer again, in that their efforts were misleading and only aimed at maximizing revenue for the dealership.  I have an 868 credit rating, yet Genesis of Greer personnel put me into a loan that I did not even want (I had a checkbook to buy the new car outright) at 7.65% interest when their website advertised 4.99 and 5.99% offers.  They also told me to keep the loan for 6 months and one day before cancelling (which would have generated nearly $2,000 interest).  When I read the loan papers, it was clear that there was no prepayment penalty, so I paid off the loan already.  Interestingly, I asked for the date representing 6 months from the loan origination, and the sales person gave me one date, and the loan manager gave me a different date, 30 days later (which would have generated an additional $250 or so in interest.  Additionally, I drove the car I bought on 4/1 a total of One hundred nine miles before it was returned to the dealer exchange for the Premier model with soft close doors.  This was because my wife and granddaughter could not close the doors without several tries.  I needed soft close doors.  As close as I can discern from the paperwork for the two purchases, it cost me over $14,000 to return a car I had only driven 109 miles.  Part of this was the $6,200 difference in the models, but the other $14,500 or so was dealer profit.  I'll never visit the property again.

column14: I missed the call from Dustin, the Genesis Customer Service rep. I had contacted Genesis about My Genesis Intelligent Assistant app, which has not communicated with my GV80 for nearly 3 months.  I got an email with step by step instructions for a "head unit reset", which I appreciate.  But the instructions don't explain what happens when I do the reset.  Do I lose some or all of my presets?  That would be good to know.  The email from Genesis also mentioned a recall to fix seat belt pretensioners, and advised that I schedule a service appointment, mentioning my case number when I schedule.  But the email does not include a link I can use to go right to service scheduling. That would be nice to have. I love my GV80 and I consider Genesis a high-value, premium brand.  Unfortunately, I find lots of little things intended to enhance the vehicle ownership experience--issues with the app; challenges with service and support--which do not match the high quality and attention to detail I see on Genesis (and Hyundai company vehicles--my wife has a 2022 Tucson Hybrid).

column14: My car is due for service, so I let the concierge schedule an appointment. They could not get a person from the dealership on the phone to confirm, so they said they would have the dealership call me. Several hours later, York Genesis called and said they no longer represented Genesis. No further help was given. I called Genesis back and explained the predicament, and they offered to schedule at a different dealership. Great, except the dealership is over 1 hour and 30 minutes away. They offered West Chester Genesis, still over an hour away. My car is due for service and a recall which will take 3-4 hours to complete. They would not confirm the loaner car either. This is not the type of service I expected from a "premium brand car." This is very poor. And will significantly influence my next car purchase. Mercedes and BMW have dealerships located in Lancaster and provide pickup service. Brian

column14:
The first person to answer was very courteous, but could not help me. I was then connected to someone else to answer my warranty question. They were as helpful as possible, but I guess my situation was very unusual. 
1. I wanted to see (either on the website or in print) exactly what my warranty was on the CPO G90 I had just bought. I have been told by my salesperson (who I credit with trying several times) and then by your customer care person, that I cannot receive a personalized copy or any exact copy of the coverage that I have. This is very difficult for me to comprehend because I received just exactly that when I bought my last CPO Genesis. It spelled out in detail exactly what was covered and what was not. The Genesis support person was able to send me a copy of a contract for someone else for a different car from 3 years ago. Is that really all that is available? The Genesis warranty would seem to me to be a very strong selling point and I would think that it should be readily available to potential buyers as well as to those who have already bought. 
2. After several inquiries for the CPO info, the dealership produced a brief electronic coversheet with the CPO contract number. However, the contract was in the name of "Melissa Roth." My name is "Michael Roth." My salesperson's first name was Melissa. Evidently, whoever processed the contract in the back office mixed those two names together. Your Genesis support person told me that the original CPO contract must now be canceled and a new one submitted by the dealer in my correct name. Like I said, this has probably never come up before. So I understand that it could not be handled quickly. But that is the reason I gave the ratings of 2 and 3, not because the support person was inept.

column14:
The service representative, Scott, was wonderful. His calmness helped me be calm because I was aggravated that my less than 1 year old luxury vehicle was undriveable. He was great & I appreciated him calling us a Lyft to get home. 

The service manager's behavior was disappointing. I couldn't get anyone in the service department on the phone, & the service manager would not answer the phone until the front desk receptionist walked down to the service area to speak with the service manager. I finally got on the phone with the service manager & was told there were no loaner vehicles then was hung up on. After that, the service manager refused to take my calls.

When I got my vehicle to the service center, he refused to speak with me. However, Scott was great, & I felt taken care of & like a priority.

The repairs were finished much earlier than I expected & was told, sobI was very happy about that.

The experience was good overall, but it was aggravating dealing with the sales manager & disappointing there weren't any loaners. I expect better treatment with a luxury brand.

column14:
I am not willing to renew my subscription because of the security and privacy concerns that lead me to opening ticket 20698273. I view a decision to refuse to support me until I pay for a service that you won’t assure me is safe and private as an absolute slap in the face. I opened this ticket MONTHS ago, was never given any status update on it despite me calling and asking multiple times. The closest I got was “we will let you know” and the first I hear back since at least January is this call and email. To come back to me all these months later and demand money or you won’t address the issue that is the very reason I won’t renew would be the height of comedy if it wasn’t tied to my car and basic features I was told my vehicle shipped with. This whole process is absolutely unacceptable. Can you legitimately look at this and say this is a “premium” experience, because your certainly trying to charge me like it is. 

I was excited when I got my Genesis, coming from BMW and Lexus historically, and totally bought into the idea your dealers sold me that you were different from the more established marques. I like it so much that I also bought my wife a Hyundai! What I didn’t understand until now that you also meant different in the sense of not following through or standing by your product. You’re certainly not different when it comes to demonstrating how little you value your customers outside of their wallets. 

I cannot believe the disrespect and callous nature of this service. I sincerely expected better. This interaction makes me want to completely step away from cars I otherwise love. If this is an experience you standby, then I intend to let everyone know what they can expect and Genesis and Hyundai are no longer brands I will be able to support. 

I would NEVER have bought this car if I knew the experience that was in store for me. 

Sincerely,

Matt Landes

column14:
The issue was that my new 2023 G90 came with several issues that need to be fixed; the most serious being that the controls for the front passenger seat don't work.   bought the car from Genesis Southwest Houston,  I had tried to set up an appointment with their department online, but the appointment was rejected because the site said that my car wasn't eligible for valet pick-up service.  The Genesis Care representative said that 3 year valet service was only available for maintenance, and that I'd have to bring my car into the dealer for service - EVEN THOUGH THIS IS A $100+ CAR THAT CAME WITH ISSUES.   She was apologetic and put me on hold while she contacted the dealer's service department to see if they'd make an exception.  They would not.  Further, even though the  Genesis Care rep said that I'd be entitled to a loaner car if the repairs took time,  she was advised by the dealer's rep that they do not have loaner cars.   Finally, the Genesis Care rep said I should consider trying the other Houston Genesis dealer to see if I'd get a better result.  Bottom line, the Genesis Care rep did what she could, but the Genesis dealer's response was inadequate.  Part of Genesis' and the dealer's marketing pitches was the high level of service compared to other luxury cars.   But, friends with BMW's, Mercedes, and Audi's in the same general price range all said this was far below the level of service they received for new cars with issues.  Hence, my "5" rating on recommending the Genesis brand to friends/colleagues - the car is great, the buying experience was great, but the service just isn't.   

Joe Carroll
joecarrolltx@gmail.com
281/728-4525

column14: Received a notice on my navigation screen when trying to use the navigation map that read "The version of the navigation map is out of date and there is not much time left to receive route guidance. Please update the map for more accurate route guidance" Actually there was no time left as i could not use the navigation map. I had no idea as to how to update the system so i called Genesis. The representative told me there was an update coming later this month but could not give me a date but suggested i try to update  the system on-line which i could not do. So here i am without a navigation mapping system working and no date as to when i would receive the updated version which i assume would be an over the air software update. The representative tried to help and was very friendly. I really like the car and it is my third Genesis but Genesis should not have terminated the current mapping system before an update version was available.

column14: I have had my 2022 Genesis GV70 since September of 2021.  Though the driving experience is rewarding I am disappointed in some of the other aspects of service; mainly having to address the issues to begin with.  My fingerprint recognition never worked and took over 6 months and several trips to the service dealer for correction.  It took me filing a complaint with USA Genesis for the issue to be resolved.   This time my navigation ceases to work and I am informed an upgrade is necessary; 1 day after I had my vehicle in for service at an authorized Genesis dealer.  I contacted Genesis Connect and the representative gave me a couple of options, but couldn’t tel me if my vehicle had an SD card or USB port for updating the navigation.  After figuring it out myself the navigation still would not register/work.  I contacted Genesis Connect yet again and even though the representative was very polite and courteous, she could not remedy the problem and had to submit a “ticket” and someone would call me.  It’s been 5 days and I have not received a callback from someone to assist me.  I am also very disappointed in the advertised “Genesis Concierge Service” when purchasing a new Genesis.  Not only is it non-existent, but the dealer doesn’t provide a loaner vehicle nor shuttle service to and from home/work.  I  would rather take my vehicle to my local service garage for service and pay the bill out of my pocket than continue to use the “authorized dealer” for covered maintenance.  The dealer didn’t even reset my oil and service reminders; they just tried to sell me additional services which according to the user/maintenance manual are not due to be serviced yet.  Very disappointed in a brand that is supposed to be elite.

I have NO voice GPS. I brought my GV80 in for service in FEB. I was told it was a software issue and the home office needs to send a flash drive to fix it. I came back May 17 for AutoPaint and the GPS. I was told again the home office needs to send a flash drive to fix it. I was also told to go my Genesis App and check when this flash drive is available and request delivery to my house. I was told it may take 8 hours to run and update my car's computer.
This is NOT proper service. You should call for the flash drive. You should install it. It should not take 4 months to fix my problem. My GPS is an important safety tool for me.  Ron Ryan 561-307-5127  rryan@ryanalm.com

column14: I used the app to start the Genesis Connected Services for my wife around late November or early December because she wanted remote start during the winter months. I used the app to cancel the service on 5/13/23 or 5/14/23 before the subscription services were renewed. On 5/18/23, I noticed my bank account was charged $19.80. I called Genesis to explain that they had charged my bank and I had already tried to cancel the service through the app, but they still charged my account. Please go into the account and shut this service off for the Summer months. The Genesis representative on the phone said she couldn't because it was under my wife's name and I wasn't on the account. I explained again that I turned it on through the app and turned it off through the app, please make sure this is disconnected! Again, she said she couldn't! This is worse than working with the cable company!! I got the supervisor and explained the situation again. I went into the app while the supervisor was on the phone and canceled it AGAIN! She explained that she could see that it was canceled, but since the account was "auto renewal" it would take a couple of days for the refund to come through. Today is 5/24/23 and my account is still showing active through the subscription. My bank account still has not been credited back. This type of service of holding your customers captive in a subscription is infuriating! This is poor customer care over $20 a month!! Look at this from a customer's perspective. You make it convenient to start and want to make it very inconvenient to get of out a subscription that I personally initiated! PLEASE, do be the cable company customer type of service. You are better than this!!! Still waiting on my refund!!

column14: My 2022 G80 stopped dead on I95 near Savannah on my trip from Hendersonville, NC to Jupiter Fl, and I was almost killed.  It took months to resolve my issue. My claims rep was not on top of the situation.  When the car was shipped to the Stuart dealership, the head of service found the problem immediately!  BAD FUEL PUMP!!!  Now my 2023 GV70 keeps telling me my Navigation is out of date and the car is 6 months old. Customer service said it would rectify itself after she gave me a link to update my GV70. It's been 3 days.  It didn't help the last 2 days.  I will see if it works today.   I'VE LOST THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS BECAUSE I BOUGHT A NEW GENESIS, and I was treated like dirt.  Anything else you want to know?  Just ask.  Laura Fiore

column14:
Genesis CC confirmed dealer's information regarding recall 012G requiring an evaluation at dealer. Depending of results dealer would order recall parts if necessary requiring ANOTHER dealer visit.. Ridiculous that the dealer does not stock parts necessary for a safety recall repair. Semi Pro at best, not to mention that the 1st appointment will be one month out.  So...if this is a safety recall I must wait a month to find out if it affects my car? and some number of additional days to resolve? Kind of a bad joke IMO.  Really hope shrapnel metal doesn't explode in my face. I don't plan on having an accident but one never knows when it can happen to you.
Up til now Genesis has been top notch. 
2nd- no additional dealerships in the 2 years since I purchased. Completely at the mercy of one dealership within 150 miles!!! Totally contradicts what Genesis CC advised me back in 2021.

column14: The representative, Ariana, promised to solve my issue, which had to do with a service date for a recall. The service appointment had been set up previously by another rep. Ariana called the dealership and was unable to speak with a service advisor to confirm the service appointment.  In fact, what she learned was that there was no appointment on the calendar. At that point she promised to call the dealership on Friday, confirm my appointment or secure another, and to call to let me know no later than 4pm PT. To date, I have no confirmed appointment and have not heard from Genesis about one. I cannot fully express my utter disappointment and frustration with the service provided. For your information, I am a 3 time Genesis owner, who has also successfully recommended the purchase of a Genesis automobile to family and friends.   This rather disappointing experience is not encouragement to continue! I hope and believe that Genesis can do better!

You guys have a LONG way to go if you want to actually be real competition to the established luxury brands.

column14:
I live in Reno, Nevada. Just over 100 miles away from the closest Genesis dealership in Roseville, CA. I am associated with many friends and family at the Hyundai dealership in Reno. I bought the GV70 because Genesis makes a fantastic car. Several weeks after having it, the drivetrain went out while I was on the highway. It was quite scary. Little did I know that wasn't going to be the worst of it. It was a nightmare getting it fixed. While purchasing my vehicle, I specifically asked about valet due to intense work and school (doctoral program). I was assured it would be no problem. That would turn out to be a lie. The person who answered most of my calls at Roseville (female) was rude and condescending each time I spoke with her over the few years I had the vehicle. Service people were slightly better, but not by much.

I had the GV70 for about eighteen months and loved the ride and comfort. It was time for it to be serviced. I traditionally paid for my oil changes through Lithia Hyundai as I dreaded dealing with Roseville Genesis. However, this service could not be avoided because of a recall and a significant service appointment. I made the valet appointment on the Genesis Connect app for a week out. Genesis Roseville rescheduled it for an additional week through the app. Not a problem as everyone gets busy. The night before the appointment, I get a call from my service advisor stating Genesis doesn't drive to where I live. Next time, please don't use the app as it doesn't account for distance, call the dealership. Wait, what? So you are saying not to use Genesis technology? I mentioned it wasn't a problem when they sold me the vehicle and drove it Reno/Carson City, and they assured me the courtesy would extend to when I owned the vehicle. The service manager stated, "We normally would meet you have way, like over Truckee or something, and exchange for a loaner." What type of shady practice is that? He stated, "We only have to go 50 miles." 

Finally, he agreed to retrieve my vehicle for service and stated it was too long of a drive to get it back the same day and I would have it the next. Not a problem, as I was grateful. I got it back several days later, but again, things happen. The check engine light came on within several days as I was driving to work. I contacted Genesis Connect. They said they would contact Roseville and have someone call me immediately when they opened. The hours rolled by with no call, and I was extremely nervous about driving my vehicle with the check engine light on and previous drive train failure. I contacted Genesis Connect. They are very nice people. They stated they were still waiting to get a hold of someone in Roseville. Finally, I called Roseville after waiting 8 or so hours from my first call to Genesis Connect. I was told rather curtly, "We received the call from Genesis Connect this morning, set up a tow if you are worried about it." They would not drive the vehicle either. I informed them I could not afford a rental while this was being worked on. They informed me, "I don't know what to tell you." First off, if your received the call from Genesis Connect in the morning, why didn't you call me back and make me wait all day? Genesis Connect apologized to me profusely for Roseville going so far as to state even they had previous and current difficulties working with that particular dealership. 

I immediately sold my GV70. One of my life's most painful experiences was dealing with Roseville Genesis and letting go of my dream car. I went back into a Hyundai Santa Fe. This experience has led to me having about $17,000 in negative equity and, with the current interest rates, a less enjoyable current vehicle which is more expensive than my previous GV70. I immediately contacted Genesis of Las Vegas to see my options for a G70, and I would pay out of pocket to have Lithia Hyundai service the vehicle. Sadly the economy is not going to allow for this. It is unfortunate Genesis did not work to continue allowing its product to be sold and serviced at Lithia Reno as many of us own Genesis vehicles. Lithia would drive across the state for its customers. I have known their GM and their sales department for almost a decade and I live with one so I know. More unfortunate that I am not the only one who had a continuous nightmare with Roseville Genesis. Roseville Genesis made my life so difficult which could have resulted in loss of employment due to no vehicle, but not their problem as they made the sale under false pretenses. They surely were not there for my service needs or even for basic customer service. It will take me years to dig out of the financial hole this has caused me.

I called the Connected Care customer support to inquire about the three way climate control on my 2023 GV80 which is not working as advertised. The first call occured in the evening and Michael suggested I schedule the service. I asked if a nearby dealership offered pickups and he didn't know but we agreed he'd find out and inform me the following day. The next day I didn't get a call back. I called back the following day and had the same experience with another agent over the following day. Therefore, I called twice and got nowhere, waiting for the customer care to resolve my issue. I called the dealership myself and agreed to drive the car in and inquire in person.
The conclusion: calling customer support is most likely a waste of time.

column14:
Genesis Customer care and Genesis USA are poorly organized and lack leadership. They don't respond to customer issues in a meaningful way even after repeated phone calls.  They do not assist or reproach dealerships with substandard performance.  There is now only one Genesis dealership in Birmingham and other Hyundai dealers are no longer servicing Genesis vehicles for reasons unclear to consumers. The next closest servicing dealership is 58 miles waya at Tuscaloosa, Al.  This has led to a volume overload at the service department of Jim Burke Genesis service department, delays of weeks getting service, no loaner vehicles when vehicle is in the shop unless the customer pays for a rental and then has to beg Genesis for reimbursement.  What happened to concierge service?  I have been trying to get an extended service contract quote from two genesis dealerships in Birmingham and Tuscaloosa and I have not received a single return call from either despite leaving 4-6 voicemails at the finance manager and service managers phones  In the meantime my factory warranty has likely expired.  Genesis customer service recommended I contact Safeguard (888)-477-9771 and when I did so they told me extended warranties have to be obtained through dealerships, not Safeguard, putting me right back where I started. Why didn’t Genesis Customer Service have the correct vendor contact me directly? I really like my car, but dealing with Genesis USA customer service and the local dealerships are more than I bargained for.  When I leased (and later purchased) my car I had to do it at an Irvine, California dealership because I could not strike a deal with the local dealerships (there were more here then) and it was still less expensive for me to have the car shipped from LA to Birmingham, than to do the deal locally. I will not lease or buy another Genesis automobile unless the problems outlined above have been corrected.  There were problems in 2018 when I leased the vehicle, but they have apparently gotten even worse since then. You many respond to this feedback in any way you choose

Paul J Troup, MD

The dealer performed as I would have expected, but the fact that I received a letter direct from GENESIS that was incorrect makes me furious!!!  Please get your act together!  I expected more from a high end brand!!!

I questioned if I could have the recall preformed by a Hyundai dealer is Salem, OR. about 40 miles away. I was told that  was not possible. My experience with my Lexus is very different.  There are no Lexus dealers on the coast and the closest dealer is in Portland. Rather than have me drive 100 miles each way I was instructed to contact the Toyota dealer 20 miles away.  Genesis is to Hyundai what Lexus is to Toyota. I'll remember this when I purchase my next car.

Dennis M. Civiello
