column14:
I called customer service to find out my options vs. waiting 14 days to have the AC serviced the Genesis of Clear Lake dealership on my 2022 GV70.   The AC blows lukewarm air and living in Houston, Texas where's it's 90+ degrees in the shade, it's not doable so the car isn't drivable.  It's sitting in the garage, waiting for my appt.  I called all 4 Genesis dealers in the Houston Metroplex and there wasn't an earlier service date.  It was explained there's limited Genesis certified service professionals and thus the wait.  Why is that my issue?  

In full transparency, I wouldn't have traded in my Mercedes SUV if I knew I couldn't drive my Genesis for blocks of time.

I asked Customer Service for a loaner while I'm waiting for my car to be serviced and they said "no".  I asked for a rental car and they said they didn't know if it would be reimbursed and I asked if they could transfer me to the dept. that makes those decisions and they said they couldn't.  

MY NEXT STEP IF I DON'T HEAR POSITIVELY BACK FROM Y'ALL IS TO POST MY CONCERNS ON SOCIAL MEDIA.  I'M ASKED OFTEN IF I LIKE MY CAR AND NOW MY ANSWER IS "NO AS IT IS TOO DIFFICULT TO SERVICE".  
Happy to talk to someone "live" who can make a positive decision.
Jennifer Green 832-618-4819

column14:
My issue with Genesis is twofold.
1.) We purchased our 2022 G70 from Genesis of Cool Springs that was several months old, with 3400 miles, yes classified as a used vehicle. Understood.  BUT, as was represented by the dealership, we believed we had the remainder of the full warranty and services related to Genesis owners.  I did not pay much attention to any of it until the 'rough road, be careful' alert from hell epidemic ensued. That is when we realized how difficult it was to join the Genesis Family in the hopes of reconciling this issue.  I think it is easier to join the Gambino Family. The last rep Araianna did a great job. It was difficult and frustrating to that point.   
2.) No one locally or at Genesis seems to know how to fix a goofy error message, this gives me pause.  Such a sophisticated car with such a feeble remedy for such a small problem.
More than a month of listening to the constant dinging.
I love the car, but I won't be buying another.
Daniel Vecere
Kathleen Carney

column14: When I requested a refund for the service not done (tire rotation) I was sent a form asking me to prove that I owned the 2019 G90.  Why should I have to prove that I own the auto?  If my friend had taken the car into service for me, it wouldn't have mattered that she didn't own the car!  My issue was that I was charged for a service that did not happen and I am still very upset with Genesis for demanding proof of ownership.  In addition, I was never told what action would be taken against the dealership for not performing the service on my auto.  I feel Genesis should somehow compensate me with future complimentary services as a way of keeping me as a customer and as a reference to others who seek to buy Genesis automobiles.  -- Donald G Turner

column14:
Overall, those I spoke to were somewhat helpful. When I spoke to the service rep about two issues (1) engine warning light (2) navigation system operation, I was told the earliest I could get in the shop to inspect and fix #1 was the end of June. When I asked if a loaner was available the answer was no and there was no way to know if one would be available later. He did suggest that I could rent something then try to get Genesis to pay for it. #2 has been a difficult one. The service guy simply said “we don’t deal with it you’ll have to contact customer services. I did and she was helpful by informing me that an update to the system was due on the 12th of June. However, I’ve had nothing but trouble trying to connect with the navigation map and software update to place an order for my Gen6 Premium upgrade which is programmed to work with my vin# KMUMADTB1NU052081.
Finally, I enjoy my GV70 but I’m less that satisfied with the companies service support.

column14:
I bought a car that hasn’t held up to the agreement that was negotiated and signed upon. I now, because of the split from Hyundai have to drive 4.5 hours to have my car serviced for a recall that is not my fault, but will keep me from re-reregistering my car IN SEPTEMBER, which happens to be the only time you have available for me? Never mind if I get pulled
over for my tabs because my car company has put me in a rock and a hard place. My registration is expired in September!  I have been told I may not even get a loaner car as is guaranteed in my contract and financial agreement. I  have to miss work costing me money, get a hotel which will cost me money, and possibly for numerous days?  All while you can’t even tell me that the fixes are within my warranty and or I have to pay more money for? I have to take my take my son out of school just to make sure my car is in good running and safe/legal for us to drive? I’m paying for extra warranties on top of this car as a single Mom and head of household that works 2 jobs and being told that you can’t even hold up your end of the deal? Absolutely ridiculous that you would consider this a luxury car or service. More of a lie and detriment to my time and hard earned money. It’s pretty shameful and embarrassing for this new brand wouldn’t you think? For the love of, please help me! This can’t be even close to ok for your executive team, leadership board, or the Genesis Brand.

column14: The Genesis Connected Service representative was very courteous and I believe honestly tried to help but was unable to resolve the problem. He said i needed a map upgrade and gave me a phone number to call; I did but with no success. I have tried numerous time to call my local dealer Key Genesis of Milford with absolutely no success! If you get an answer they transfer the call and it goes no where. I finally drove to the dealership last Friday and was directed to talk with the service manager, Alex Zapata. Mr. Zapata said they their phone system was very bad. He also told me the problem I described was not uncommon and that the map upgrade (because it is somehow connected with the computer system) should fix the problem. He told me the upgrade was not covered under the warranty, but he personally would install the upgrade. He said he would call me Monday or Tuesday (today). I did not hear back from him and once again could not get through on the phone. I drove to the dealership again today and was told that Mr. Zapata was not available. a service writer, who was very nice, took my name and number and said he would ask Mr. Zapata to call me. I did not hear back. This is my second Genesis having owned  several Mercedes before. I very much like my current 2023 GV70 3.5TS and have in the past been very happy with the help I have received from connected services when I had problems with electronic issue. GCS was able to do a re-boot while I was in my car with them on the phone. Unfortunately GCS was unable to correct the problem. My Voice Command and Phone Connection stopped working, this is very inconvenient. Any help you, GCS can provide will be greatly appreciated. At this time I have no confidence Key Genesis will be of any help. Sincerely, Bill Kolkmeyer (203-856-4669)

I was explained by the technician the the reason that connected services was disconnected is because I did not use the mobile application for a few days… really ? I need to remind my car not to forget about my existence ?? Really ???

This is happened to me for the second time in a couple of weeks
I will call you headquarters and vocalize my piece of mind.. and they are not going to like it
And NO
I WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS BREND TO MY FRIENDS 
FOR these money I could of just get me the BMW X5 without any problems and a beautiful waiting area and service in the service department.. and “loaners”… and other REAL PREMIUM thingies…

column14: When the vehicle gets a message that it needs the transmission serviced with less than 5K miles and it’s a two month wait to get into the local/authorized (Roseville) dealer for service, that’s a big problem and not a sustainable business model for the brand, regardless of how nice the vehicles appear aesthetically. The brand just seems very much cart before the horse. Being picked up and receiving a loaner seems laughable at this point. Overpromising and under-delivering is not a good look for a fledgling “luxury” brand. 36 months complimentary maintenance is a nice feature when a company makes itself available to access. column14:
The agent was great.  But I'm angry and I'll explain why.  I have called Genesis Customer Care multiple times asking when I'd receive OTA updates for our two 2023 GV70 Sport Prestige.  It wasn't until this call anyone told me, we needed to accept OTA updates through some link (which by the way, is broken and doesn't work at all).  In fact, the Genesis Owners Home page rarely works.  It hasn't worked all weekend.  How can a company who builds cars as great as these cars have such bad systems supporting their customers?  How?  I'd really love an answer.

Now to why I'm really angry.  When I got in my car yesterday, all radio stations, my iPhone pairing, and all settings were simply wiped away.  I had to repair my phone, reset all radio stations, reset all settings to my preferences, reenter my passcode, reenter my finger print.  This took a lot of work.  And today, I read on one of my Genesis Forums, this happened to a LOT of people.  I mean A LOT OF PEOPLE.  

Why?  How could our cars simply be wiped clean of all connections and settings?  Why didn't anyone from Genesis let us know something was being worked on and let us know what we could do to prevent the total wipeout of our cars settings?  Besides not being able to log into the Genesis Owners Page, I've been trying to accept the ability to receive over the air updates for a couple days now.   Why is it so ridiculously difficult to get the ability to get OTA updates to begin with?  My 2019 Mercedes E450 got them without issue and I never had to sign into some non-functioning page to accept them.  As long as I was connected to Mercedes Me Services, my car got updates.  To be honest, I adore my car, but your systems access leaves beyond a lot to desire.  I'm IT Recruiter by profession, I'd be happy to help you hire programmers who won't mess up half your customer base.  

I want someone from Genesis to reach out to me and explain why I along with hundreds (possibly thousands) of owners had the systems in our cars simply wiped of all settings?

I want to know why its so unbelievably difficult to accept getting over the air updates.  It should simply be automatic and not this hard to get.

Again, someone from Genesis needs to reach out to me.  This was simply unacceptable.  Genesis owes a personal apology to EVERYONE whose car was messed up to the point they had to reset everything possible in them.  And honestly, Genesis should compensate us for the multiple hours it took to reset everything.  This was a really BAD experience, which I'm sure could have been completely avoided.  You need to do better.  You really do.  

Rod Brylawski
You can reach me at:  813-505-1782
rbrylaw55@yahoo.com

On your side, the rep. may have been anxious, frustrated, having a bad day or something, but this situation is important for the customer. Thank you for your time!

column14:
I own a GV60.  I also belong to the FaceBook Genesis GV60 USA page.  Through that page, I’m getting a lot of information, including potential problems (a lot of people are reporting 12 volt battery failures, plus there have been reports of rear half-shaft failures overseas, that there might be a recall on those), and many positives of owning a GV60.  Your representative was good, but he didn’t know about any of these issues and was surprised that I did.  I told him about the page.  

I do an exceptional amount of reading up on whatever I wind up buying to drive, plus now there are all of the YouTube videos for my car that have proven helpful.  It may be asking a lot, but your customer care reps should be familiar with all of these tools.  It will make them more responsive to customer needs, particularly “finicky” customers,  like me.  I don’t know everything about the GV60, but I’m up on enough things to the point where I felt I knew more about the car than the rep did.  I feel that should be the other way around, but then this has been a problem with dealing with me.  I’ve always known more about the car I buy than most of the sales people and after-care people do.  I will say that so far, the service people working on the car (Dublin Genesis and Roseville Genesis) were good on filling in the gaps for me, particularly with the recent safety belt recall notice (which the FB GV60 group knew was coming months before it actually happened).  

This is a very nice car.  I’d like to see Genesis get to the level of more established luxury brands, when it comes to customer service.  My experiences so far have been good, but reviews from other customers tell me that there’s a lot of improvement needed.  Moving your dealers out of the Hyundai banner is a good first step.  The GV60 and other Genesis models deserve the best, if they’re going to run with “the big dogs,” including Lexus, Audi, Mercedes-Benz, and BMW.  I hope someone actually reads this and doesn’t disregard it.

Representative was awesome.  10 out of 10.  The process supporting the representative failed us both.  Had a problem as a result of a software upgrade.  Representative just checked in at work. She did not receive any briefing on hot issues for the day, nor was she provided an opportunity to review problems as a result of upgrade.  

Wait time was 45+ mins to talk to representative.

None of this was her fault. She was terrific.   Customer representatives should have an operational briefing after clocking in and before talking to any customers.  Especially in the day/days after major software upgrade to your flagship product.  This briefing should include known issues and known fixes so they are prepared to provide the best customer care on their very first call of the day.

column14:
I have enjoyed my 2017 Genesis G-80, and think Genesis has a wonderful.  However, the problems I have experienced are typically related to the entertainment package and now the Genesis Connect Service provided by Genesis.  I attempted to reconnect services to my vehicle, and received a message stating “ Genesis Connected Services is required to access the Genesis app.
Due to third party cellular network changes Genesis Connected Services is no longer available for this vehicle.”

What is the point to having a smart car when I can not use those features?  The car works the service is available, but because the modem is 3G I can’t get service. It seems to me that if Genesis valued its customers and stood behind their product they would have issued a recall or some avenue for owners to continue their service.

column14:
While my experience with Customer Care was great, I would prefer to NOT HAVE TO CALL THEM!  This is my third Genesis and only this one has had repeated issues with the screen head software.  I have wasted hours on the phone and hours resetting my profile.  PLEASE add required QA to your sw change control process or at least beta test it with agreeable owners!!  In addition, I have convinced my Mom, sister and recently my daughter to purchase Hyundai products.  

They have all experienced similar "lack of sw quality" issues.  My daughter, 2023 Tucson, has been without a stereo for over one month and lost her profile settings four (4) times in under 7000 miles - PLEASE, PLEASE Address this issue ASAP - I am no longer recommending the brand as I have done in the past (2 friends have purchased Genesis vehicles)  Thank you for listening, but PLEASE take appropriate action!!

column14:
You have a serious problem with the GV60's level 2 charing capability. When charging from home, the car will charge in 1-2% increments, then shut-off. I understand that this same problem is prevalent in the Hyndai and Kia comparable electric cars. When you advertise that your car will charge to 80% in approximately 20 minutes, and it takes me 18 hours to charge my car repeatedley resetting the start mode, this is unacceptable. To have spent this much for this car to have these type of problems is unfathonable. Unless I receive an immediate response, I intend to pursue legal action against Genesis and the dealer.  You sold me a lemon. 
Richard Peel
You can reach me at 702.561.7272.

column14:
Genesis Worldwide Genesis USA Genesis G90 Owners Today I had the most disappointing experience with Genesis. I woke up to my doors being locked with the key in my brief case in the rear seat. I never locked the doors. I turned to the Genesis App to unlock the doors. After 6 hours of trying and failing, I called Genesis Customer Care. I nice woman read a script to me explaining that their system was having “connectivity issues” and while apologizing said there was nothing she could do. She suggest I contact roadside asssitance. Never offering the number or to connect me - I disconnected the call and called back to the Genesis Customer Care number. The first option was for Roadside Assistance which I selected. I was greeted with “the number you have dialed is not in service” - clearly I thought this must be in error, so I tried the number several more times with the same result. 

Finally, I called the Genesis Customer Care representative who explained that they were having “connectivity issues” with Roadside Assistance and suggested I call my insurance carrier for help. 

After spending nearly $100k on a vehicle THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. My car is a 2022 and under warranty. I got 3 years of “free”
“Customer Care” for which they would charge me in year 4. My other car is a BMW for which my ownership experience has been FLAWLESS. 

The result: after asking to speak with a supervisor the rep miraculously found a way to contact me with roadside assistance. AAA did a wonderful job. 

I love my Genesis G90, but the purchase and support of ownership experience is pathetic!!
#G90 #Genesis #supportsucks #unacceptable

column14:
The customer care expert I spoke to one the phone was very pleasant, professional and able to steer me through the complicated map up date process. This cumbersome and over technically complex procedure requires the customer to: (1) download the installer program to their computer; (2) download the map files; (3) obtain a thumb drive; (4) reformat the thumb drive; (5) plug it in and and then download the new data. Recommend that you guys:  (1) figure out how to install the update over the air, or (2) as an absolute minimum, send your customers a thumb drive with the new data on it, requiring only that they plug it into the car receptacle to install. 

Note: when the Nav system failed, it was absolutely useless and the local dealer - Genesis of Naples, has a waiting time for appointments of weeks, including important recall repairs.  I made an appointment to have a seatbelt recall job done - the dealer cancelled the appointment informing that they do not have the parts on hand - and suggesting that I call later sometime, to see if the parts have come in!
Great car and Customer Care Center support -  not great dealer service support.

column14:
There appears to be a disconnect between the Genesis Customer Care team and the dealerships.  In a previous issue a representative called me to follow-up then notified me of a recall.  She set up an appointment of me, but when I called the dealership a few days before the appointment, the dealership had no record and accused the Genesis Customer Care service to be be separate from the dealerships.  The Genesis Customer Care rep put me on hold to schedule the appointment so I know it was done.  I then tried to speak with the Service Manager at the dealership, which took several follow-up calls over a couple of weeks.  After confirming there was no appointment, he then told me that there was a major issue between Genesis and their dealership that is preventing them from adequately servicing Genesis vehicles and providing loaners.  Way too much information for me, and honestly, I found it to be inappropriate although I can understand how frustrated he was.  In the end, he pointed me to another Genesis dealership in the area (further away).  I called there and could not get an appointment for over 2 MONTHS!  The staff at that dealership was less than helpful.  I felt like I was a burden and he was just doing his job.  Very blatantly ambivalent.  Possibly overworked, but not my issue.  As a Genesis owner, we are sold on getting extras service since Genesis is a luxury brand.   That is not happening.  No valet service.  At the first dealership, betting a loaner was close to impossible.  I am gathering it is worse now with the issues between the dealership and Genesis.  I love my car, but the service is not good.   

The most recent call to Genesis Customer Care was not as good as the first.  She was nice, but didn't seem interested in what I was saying.  Part of my call's purpose was to figure out what the app was saying needed to be serviced because I had completed the 2 oil changes per the mileage requirements, but it still showed an outstanding service.  Did not get that resolved, but did get instructions on updating something relative to this in my car.  I am not expecting over the top service, but as a luxury brand, the Customer Care Service was presented as a nice perk.  Not so much.

I only have excellent service from Genesis. I am not happy with the new dealer (Autonation) who has recently purchased Bob Baker Carlsbad. About 6 weeks ago I made an appointment at Bob Baker for service on my 2021 Genesis G80. After I made the appointment, and prior to the day of the appointment, Autonation purchased Bob Baker Carlsbad and no longer services Genesis. No one at Autonation reached out to advise me my service appointment was no longer possible at that dealership. I only found out when I drove in the morning of the appointment. An employee there told me staff reductions made by Autonation made it impossible to contact those now abandoned customers. I have scheduled service at Genesis of Escondido, and I expect that to go smoothly. I do not expect Genesis to fix what was broken by Autonation.  But I sure hope Genesis thinks twice before allowing Autonation to participate with the Genesis name in the future. Autonation is not demonstrating they care about customer service. 
Thanks.

Fantastic car, fantastic customer service. Shopping for my second Genesis now!!!

column14: My concern was more of a corporate direction one, so I didn't really expect much of a response.  My question was when is Genesis going to build a Genesis-only dealership in the Cleveland, Ohio area.  The response I got was it was up to the local dealers to take the initiative to open one.  How about Genesis taking a proactive approach to making it an attractive financial decision for one of the Hyundai dealers (or a local luxury brand dealer) to open one??  Corporate needs to build brand equity in this market and you need to make this happen!

column14:
I was passed from "help" to "help" without any HELP!!

Disconnected or hung up more than once!

I was trying to find out if I could get a HARD COPY brochure of the 2023 Genesis GV70.

I must have called 3-4 different phone numbers and could not get a satisfactory YES or NO.

Did you know you have a dealer in Florida whose name is "GENESIS HEADQUARTERS"?  I even called them, and it took a couple of minutes to sink in it was NOT Genesis Headquarters!

I presently drive a Genesis G70 I plan on replacing with the GV70.  My daughter drives a G80 that she plans on replacing with another G80.

It is a good thing I/we like your cars because your customer service leaves much to be desired!!!!

I was going to purchase the SELECT package but after reading the digital version of the brochure I believe I should have selected the Advanced package.  Too late now since my GV70 Select will be arriving the end of July and I am not going to cancel that order and wait another couple of months to get what I really want.

The Genesis dealer in Plano Texas and in particular the salesman I have been working with (Jon Kan) are GREAT.  If it was not for their professionalism I probably would have gone to Audi for my next car (Avant Allroad).

Peter LaFlamme
Richardson, Texas
